abstract.para: Learn how to log in to &gnome; Desktop, and how to pause or finish the session.

section.title: Logging in to &gnome; Desktop
section.para: When starting your &productname; system, you first see a login screen as all users must authenticate to start a session. The authentication step helps protect your personal information and data from unauthorized access.

step.para: In the login screen, select your user name.
If your user name is not listed, click Not listed?. Then enter your user name and click Next.
Enter your password and confirm with .

note.title: Enabling Auto Login
note.para: If a computer is used by a single person only, it is possible to enable Auto Login for this particular user at system start. This can save time, but also impacts account security. Auto Login can be enabled or disabled during installation or at any time using the &yast; User and Group Management module. For security reasons, Auto Login is not recommended.
